snippet: Dispersed to nearby towns and cities, Gramalote, Colombia, residents are slowly returning to the devastated town, to live among the ruins or at least in sight of them.
abstract: Gramalote Journal; residents of Gramalote, Colombia, who left after the town was destroyed in December 2010, when the ground began to move after heavy rains, are slowly returning to live among the ruins, or at least in sight of them; many of the displaced have grown weary of government promises to rebuild.

byline.contributor: Jenny Carolina González contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Dispersed to nearby towns and cities, Gramalote, Colombia, residents are slowly returning to the devastated town, to live among the ruins or at least in sight of them.

headline.seo: Residents Trickle Back to Ruins of Gramalote, Colombia
headline.main: Trickling Back to Live Among, and Off of, a Hill Town’s Ruins
headline.print_headline: Trickling Back to Live Among, and Off of, a Hill Town’s Ruins
